 I use mostly my boxes, and I get a mix of voice types. I miss almost ever=
ything direct, so I almost always tape the sessions. There's a huge amount =
that I don't hear live at all. Then there's voices where I can pick up any =
tape, no matter when it was recorded, and there's voioces that address what=
's happening at eh current moment. I have often wondered if I can just reco=
rd one tape, and always get different voices from it.
 
 Voices-from the so=
ng "See You On the Other Side" by Ozzi. 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom:=
 ursulabielski@...: Fri, 30 Nov 2007 17:37:09 +0000Subject: [=
EVP-ITC] Confused



Hi, guys--If anyone feels like enlightening a newbie, =
I need some clarification:As a 'ghosthunter' I always wore headphones while=
 recording EVP in the field so that I could hear the responses in real time=
. Now, while engaged in this structured in-home ITC experimentation, I am g=
etting a lot of different results and hearing a lot of conflicting informat=
ion.My first voice I heard in real time through my headphones, and it came =
as a gravelly whisper in reponse to my question. My second voice was loud a=
nd clear but I didn't hear it through the headphones while recording.From a=
ll of the talk about the various boxes, I am hearing that the great thing a=
bout them--and the allegedly dangerous thing--is that you can have conversa=
tions in real time because you can hear the responses while recording. But,=
 from what I've read in extensive sources, I have garnered that the message=
s are IMBEDDED into the tape during the recording and cannot be heard until=
 playback. But I HAVE gotten real time responses, so . . . since I have got=
ten responses in real time without a box, is it that the boxes increase the=
 incidence of real time answers? Or am I trying to find solid answers to qu=
estions that are still not answerable?Hope this makes sense, and thanks,Urs=
ula 






________________________________________________________________=
_
You keep typing, we keep giving. Download Messenger and join the i=92m In=
itiative now.
http://im.live.com/messenger/im/home/?source=3DTAGLM
--_13d58786-13a2-474a-a29e-097f61c341aa_

 I use mostly my boxes, and I get a mix of voice=
 types. I miss almost everything direct, so I almost always tape the sessio=
ns. There's a huge amount that I don't hear live at all. Then there's voice=
s where I can pick up any tape, no matter when it was recorded, and th=
ere's voioces that address what's happening at eh current moment. I have of=
ten wondered if I can just record one tape, and always get different voices=
 from it.<BR>
 <BR>
 Voices-from the song "See You On the Other&n=
bsp;Side" by Ozzi. <BR><BR><BR>
<BLOCKQUOTE>
<HR>

ng a newbie, I need some clarification:<BR><BR>As a 'ghosthunter' I always =
wore headphones while recording EVP in <BR>the field so that I could hear t=
he responses in real time. Now, <BR>while engaged in this structured in-hom=
e ITC experimentation, I am <BR>getting a lot of different results and hear=
ing a lot of conflicting <BR>information.<BR><BR>My first voice I heard in =
real time through my headphones, and it <BR>came as a gravelly whisper in r=
eponse to my question. My second <BR>voice was loud and clear but I didn't =
hear it through the headphones <BR>while recording.<BR><BR>From all of the =
talk about the various boxes, I am hearing that the <BR>great thing about t=
hem--and the allegedly dangerous thing--is that <BR>you can have conversati=
ons in real time because you can hear the <BR>responses while recording. Bu=
t, from what I've read in extensive <BR>sources, I have garnered that the m=
essages are IMBEDDED into the tape <BR>during the recording and cannot be h=
eard until playback. <BR><BR>But I HAVE gotten real time responses, so . . =
. since I have gotten <BR>responses in real time without a box, is it that =
the boxes increase <BR>the incidence of real time answers? Or am I trying t=
o find solid <BR>answers to questions that are still not answerable?<BR><BR=
>Hope this makes sense, and thanks,<BR>Ursula<BR><BR><BR></DIV><SPAN style=
=3D"COLOR: white"></SPAN>
